Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Father Donald Baker, St. Teresa Catholic Church, 141 Henry Street, New York, New York 10002.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Gerson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Father Donald Baker, St. Teresa Catholic Church, 141 Henry Street, New York, New York 10002.

Council Member Gerson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 29, 2006 be adopted as printed by Council Member de Blasio.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member de Blasio moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 29, 2006 be adopted as printed.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to change the minimum standards for investigating excessive student absences and reporting such absences to the State Central Registrar in order to better safeguard children.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: NYC Dept of Education to change the minimum standards for investigating excessive student absences and reporting such absences to the State Central Registrar in order to better safeguard children.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to mandating that the commissioner of the fire department promulgate rules requiring certain building owners to file a list with the fire department indicating the number of each floor of the building.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Granting the commissioner of the fire department the authority to promulgate rules requiring the owners of buildings in occupancy group J-2 to file floor plans with the fire department.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to reschedule next year’s Primary Election to a date other than September 11, 2007.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Reschedule next year’s Primary Election to a date other than September 11, 2007.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to plating and decking during street openings and excavations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Plating and decking during street openings and excavations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a bicycle safety taskforce.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creating a bicycle safety taskforce.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie)

The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie).

The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) was not present at this Meeting; Council Member Comrie assumed the Chair as acting presiding officer and President Pro Tempore.

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 060526 HAK, an Urban Development Action Area Designation and Project, located at 7 Saratoga Avenue and 1510-1524 Broadway, and the disposition of such property, Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 41.  This matter is subject to Council Review and action pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter and Article 16 of the General Municipal Law
Items.MinutesNote: Filed Pursuant to Letter of Withdrawal
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Filed by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: UDAAP, 7 Saratoga Ave. & 1510-1524 Broadway, Brooklyn (C060526HAK)

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Tuesday, January 9, 2007.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: At a certain point in the Meeting, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Silence in memory of former U.S. President Gerald R. Ford who died at the age of 93 on December 26, 2006.
